p: In China, all laboratory-confirmed A(H7N9) cases are reported through a national influenza surveillance system. The case definitions for confirmed human infection with avian influenza A(H7N9) virus were on the basis of the H7N9 case definitions as recommended by the World Health Organization [11]. All A(H7N9) patients in this study were identified through the national influenza surveillance system and confirmed with A(H7N9) virus infection by RT-PCR.
